summary: Added kick-rolled boulders: kicking a boulder can now set it rolling like a low-momentum rolling-boulder trap, crushing entities in its path.
Refactored rolling-boulder trap simulation into a shared helper (rollBoulderFrom) so traps and kicked boulders use consistent movement, door interactions, and collision rules.
Chasm impacts now consistently describe forming a rough bridge when a boulder fills a chasm tile.
notes: Kicked boulders reuse the same collision logic as boulder traps: they can smash doors (chance scales with Might/level), crush and scatter entities, and fill chasms into rough bridges.
The shared rollBoulderFrom helper also supports trap-style spawning (including an initial on-tile crush) to keep rolling-boulder behavior centralized and easier to extend.
Boulder roll damage includes a momentum-based bonus that decays as the boulder travels, so long rolls are less lethal than point-blank kicks.
